snippet: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs.
abstract: Supreme Court ruling on the new health care law will have vast implications for Medicaid and the 250,000 people who will benefit from the expansion of the program in Arkansas alone; state officials everywhere worry about the costs associated with expanding Medicaid programs, and one of the aspects of the law that the Supreme Court is deliberating on is the ability of Congress to attach conditions to money it distributes to states.
lead_paragraph: The expansion of Medicaid in the health care law, if it is upheld, would greatly increase the number of people served — and add to the program’s costs.

headline.seo: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.main: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid
headline.print_headline: In Health Care Ruling, Vast Implications for Medicaid

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
